lines.text: When Gabriel blows his trumpet, I shall be playing the tuba.
My singular critique of the Good Book... is that its covers are too far apart.
Excuse me?
I am of the opinion that the, uh, Bible... is perhaps, the greatest assemblage of lies and untruths ever gathered together, with the possible exception of the Congressional record.
Are you an atheist, sir?
Yes, ma'am. Thanks to your God. I am an athiest.
Then there is no hope for your soul on the final day. When Gabriel blows his horn, your ears will be deaf... to the resounding tone of its glory, Mr. Bierce.
Oh, no. On the contrary, when Gabriel blows his horn, I shall be playing the tuba.
Any last words?
Death is the end of pain - the last pain.
Senor, a lot of white folks go missing in these parts. Can I ask your name in case someone come looking?
Bierce. Ambrose Bierce. And no one will come looking.
You killed your mother and father? Why?
They were starvin', there was no food, so I sent 'em to a better place.
What about your aunt, your uncle, and all your cousins?
I never liked them.
Get out of the way or I'll blow you an extra hole.
You have no idea what you have unleashed.
Leave him alone. He's an honorable man.
Do you feel like a horse's ass, huh? 'Cause that's what you look like! The horse's ass pendeja!
I weren't gonna steal it or nothin'. I just wanted to see it up close.
Is this close enough?
Yes, sir.
Any last words?
See you in hell?
What kind of work?
The kind of work girls do.
I don't think I'm that kind of girl.
Sooner or later all girls are that kind of girl.
They say when a man drinks, he develops certain... powers.
What kind of powers?
Clairvoyance. Second sight.
My wife is right, Mr. Bierce. You ought to take better care of yourself.
This is a preservative, and I'm pickling myself for your great... beyond.
My liquor. Give it back.
Water, then?
Tequila!
That's my cue. Two bottles of your very finest. Thank you. Milk, indeed.
I'll stand the peddler to a drink.
You like the dress? You want it?
Yeah.
You can have it, for 50 pesos!
I see you read the papers.
I'm a journalist by trade.
It's really quite an extraordinarily compromising position.
This is a preservative, I'm pickling myself.
We don't need no stinkin' brushes.
